column4: i pluged in a wireless usb 2.0 adapter and it worked as soon as it was plugged in but a probably occurred after about 30 mins it suddenly stopped working and I am think b/c i have not installed the drivers, i put in the cd but it only comes up as windows exe file installation
is it plugged into a hub?
no its plugged into the back of the desktop computer on an lubuntu 10.10
what file system is it formatted with?
ext4, the latest filesystem which is ext4
what happens when you unplug it and then plug it back in?
does the drive have it's own power supply?
i don't think so, its just the usb that is built into my motherboard
no I mean the external drive..
no its just a usb wireless adapter, when i plug it in, its green led lights up and then it comes up but for some reason it then chips out and stops working
I thought we were talking about an external usb harddrive.. formatted with ext4.. not a wireless adaptor

sorry my fault, no i am having problems with an usb wireless adaptor, thats why i was asking about drivers and getting the drivers installed from the cd into lubuntu 10.10 so it does not stop after 30 mins

whole different topic.. sorry I'm not much good with wireless adaptors.. I've been lucky with a little advanced planning.  however if it connects and then times out for some reason then it *might* be a driver problem.. or something else.
